intro: Xylopia sclerophylla, commonly known as the African bitter apple, is a tropical plant belonging to the Annonaceae family. It is characterized by its woody, evergreen structure and small, leathery leaves that are typically arranged oppositely on the stems. The plant produces fragrant, white flowers followed by round, yellow or green fruits that contain a single seed. Its botanical features make it well adapted to humid, tropical environments. Xylopia sclerophylla is often found in forest understories and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties.
